headline: LinkedIn Top Voice in Disability Advocacy | Founder & CEO of Diversability | 3x TEDx Speaker | Well+Good Changemaker, TikTok Trailblazer | Previously: Goldman Sachs, Bloomberg, REVOLT
about:
I am building and funding the things I wish existed when I was younger. 

I am the CEO & founder of Diversability, an entirely disabled-run and disabled-led social enterprise to elevate disability pride (think of us like a Disability Employee Resource Group ERG that exists outside of a company) and the founder of the Awesome Foundation Disability Chapter, which awards monthly micro-grants to disability projects ($59.5k to 60 projects in 10 countries). I am a 3x TEDx speaker and have spoken at the World Economic Forum Annual Meeting in Davos, Singularity, Harvard, Stanford, and more. My first book, The Anti-Ableist Manifesto, will be published by Hachette Go in 2024.

Previously, I worked at a venture-backed co-living startup, Sean Diddy Combs’s music network REVOLT TV, and Bloomberg. I started my career in investment banking at Goldman Sachs, where I worked on over $14 billion of announced transactions.

Featured in: Marie Claire, Forbes, the Guardian, The Wall Street Journal
Writing featured in: World Economic Forum, Fortune Magazine, Business Insider, Thrive Global

Background: content creation, content strategy, influencer partnerships, community management, social media, web development, corporate development, corporate finance, investment banking, recruiting, journalism

Named: 
- 2022 Career Mastered Diversity IMPACT 50
- World’s 10 Visionary Leaders to Follow in 2022
- BuzzFeed 2021 Women to Watch
- Asian Hustle Network Top 50 Unsung Heroes 2021 list
- 2020 Straubel Impact Leader
- 2020 Facebook Community Accelerator, Demo Day winner
- OBO 100 Most Innovative Leaders
- Summit Impact Fellow
- 14 women of color to follow on Instagram
- 2018 Susan M. Daniels Disability Mentoring Hall of Fame
- "Davos 50" Global Shaper at the World Economic Forum Annual Meeting 2018
- 14 timeless TEDx talks (Thrive Global)
- 100 most influential Asian Americans of 2017

Speaking inquiries: sean@collectivespeakers.com
Paid partnership inquiries: camila.kann@whalar.com

For people outside my network that want to get in touch or work with me, I can be reached at http://tiffanyyu.com.

** Note that I generally don't accept connection requests from people I haven't met. If you enjoy my content, please follow me here or @imtiffanyyu across any social media platforms. If we have met and I haven't accepted your request, please include a message so I see it! **

I am trained as a Computer Scientist and as a Financial Economist. I love helping business understand the economic impact of using technology, and I am also an accomplished programmer that puts systems in production. 

I am comfortable speaking and presenting to CEOs, CFOs and CTOs and have done so hundreds of times. I also love presenting to students. 

Most of all, I’m a real person. I am an introvert that loves to be helpful to people. I am comfortable knowing that I don’t know everything. 

Most importantly, I am a husband, a father of three and a caregiver for someone with MBC. 🎀

headline: Chief Solutions Officer
about:
In a region bound with both potential and under penetration in technological transformation, Sabina Schneider oversees Globant’s modern problem-solving for North America and Canada top companies. Her multifaceted approach with her team brings together the company’s complex ecosystems of expertise, combining technology, design, data, and culture to craft intuitive solutions not to meet, but to exceed client expectations.

Coming from a hard-skill career background in big data and backend scalable platforms, Sabina joined Globant when it was a startup of 20 people. In the studios, she worked with the diverse team to develop smart corporate products incorporating machine learning, artificial intelligence and image processing to provide long-term value. The company has since grown to a 12 thousand-mind team working in 16 countries for the world’s top brands. She credits Globant’s culture of resilience as the driver for its growth and cohesion along the way.

Sabina focuses on delivering transformation programs by breaking down big business challenges into actionable elements to achieve a shorter time to market with continuous delivery. She bridges the gap between technical skill and business acumen, and helps companies become more competitive through data-driven, rapid, and dynamic technology solutions.

Sabina is an expert in Agile methodologies, development, and big data strategies, and has spoken at several industry events including the Medellín Hackathon, the London Big Data Breakfast, the Bogotá Big Data Hackathon, and the AWS Big Data Breakfast Summit in both São Paulo and New York.

Sabina has a passion for languages, effortlessly expressing her ideas in Spanish, German and English, and with an additional interest in developing her Russian and French. She also enjoys open water swimming and running.

headline: Chief People Officer at McAfee | Forbes Contributor | CNBC Executive Council Member | Chief Member
about:
Chatelle Lynch is a performance-driven HR executive (CHRO/CPO) with a 20+ year track record in leading the design and execution of initiatives across the U.S. and abroad. She is expert in providing strategic vision and partnering with business leaders to cultivate world-class, pay-for-performance cultures. Her diverse global experience spans across India, China, Australia, the U.K., France, Germany, Brazil, the U.S and more. 

Lynch joined McAfee in 2005, later helping it evolve during its time as a wholly owned subsidiary of Intel, until today: an independent $3BN global IT security software company with 7,500+ employees worldwide. 

As a senior HR leader, Lynch has played a pivotal role in achieving strategic alignment to recruit, retain, and develop the best talent in the industry. She is passionate about driving diversity in the workplace and has spoken on this topic at many industry events. In 2018, her efforts towards driving diversity were recognized by the California Diversity Council in its list of ‘Top 50 Most Powerful Women in Technology.’
Lynch is also a regular contributor on HR and workforce trends for Forbes as well as an industry commentator on diversity, online safety for kids, the cyber security skills shortage and more.  

In 2017, Lynch was named 'Chief Human Resources Officer of the Year' at the 2017 Stevie Awards for Great Employers; her team was also named 'HR Department of the Year' in the same awards.

headline: Software Engineer @ Microsoft | Purdue University
about:
Ever since I understood the meaning of the word optimization I have had an ongoing interest in getting the most out of processes and real-life experiences. Whether it is deciding on what algorithm to use in order to solve a complex problem or whether I am choosing the order of the places to visit while vacationing, I am always looking for the best possible alternative. Hand in hand with optimizing systems, I also have a passion for technology and data, which I consider catalysts that help us achieve what all companies are looking for, high efficiency and maximum productivity. 

I am currently a senior at Purdue University studying Industrial Engineering, with a minor in Computer Science, and finding data-driven solutions to real-world problems is my passion. I am looking forward to getting involved in projects and experiences where I can build new skills and better my current ones.

headline: Digital transformation leader - Global Financial Services
location: New York, New York, United States
about:
Peter is an experienced digital transformation leader with a demonstrated history of working in the Global Fintech Industry.  He is skilled in Customer Relationship Management (CRM),  Fintech Software, Trading Systems, and an understanding of the Financial Services and Investment Industry. 

His career started in the UK with Thomson Reuters, where he worked in Account Management and Client Services. He built and grew relationships with global financial services customers. 

At Thomson Reuters, Peter was a steering committee member of TRUBEN (Thomson Reuters UK Black Employee Network).  In that role, he organized industry networking events and mentoring opportunities for young professionals.

At Bloomberg, he worked as a Sr Solution Specialist covering the East Coast America.  He was responsible for the sales and account management of Real-time Market Data and Technology Solutions, Quantitative and Systematic Solutions, and Enterprise Data Management Solutions. 

At Microsoft, he manages strategic relationships at global banks, helping guide digital transformation strategies across a cloud platform of enterprise productivity applications and devices.

Areas of expertise include Presenting, Relationship Building, Account Management, Business to Business Consultative Sales, Digital Transformation, Sales Enablement, Sales Process, Change Management, Workflow Improvement, Forecasting, Pipeline Generation, Sales Best Practices and Digital Selling.

To learn more about how Microsoft can transform your business and enable your teams, please contact me via LinkedIn IM, email: peter.onireti@microsoft.com or phone: (646) 6245435

headline: Digital Transformation and Innovation | Empowering Businesses through Technology
about:
Welcome to my LinkedIn profile! I am a dynamic business leader and tech innovator dedicated to driving digital transformation for organizations to achieve sustainable success in the rapidly evolving business landscape.

With a diverse skill set combining business acumen and technical expertise as a Full-Stack Software Engineer, I have a proven track record of leveraging information technology to optimize operations, reduce costs, and exceed client expectations. My success lies in my ability to implement innovative initiatives that drive sales growth, improve team cohesion, and enhance accuracy through robust monitoring procedures.

As a goal-oriented open-source software enthusiast, I thrive on staying ahead of industry trends and incorporating cutting-edge technologies into business strategies. I possess a strong background in managing information systems and delivering actionable business insights that empower decision-makers to make impactful choices.

Throughout my career, I have consistently demonstrated my ability to reduce company costs, foster team collaboration, and exceed goals while maintaining a client-centric approach. I am driven by the desire to be a positive force in the business world, where I can contribute to shaping the future of organizations through technology-driven solutions.

If you are seeking a results-driven professional who can navigate complex challenges, lead successful digital transformation initiatives, and propel your organization towards sustainable growth, let's connect and explore how we can collaborate to achieve remarkable outcomes.

Let's drive digital transformation together!

headline: Data & Analytics - WW Sales and GTM

Working with a talented team of professionals and partners, I lead the sales strategy and execution for Data & AI at Microsoft.  Microsoft’s Data&AI portfolio spans solutions for the Modernization of customer’s existing data estate, Data platforms for new cloud-native applications, Analytics platforms, and Artificial Intelligence. 

My background: After 4 years in dot-com startups, I joined Microsoft in Brazil in 1999 and moved to Microsoft Corp. in Redmond in 2012, where I run the Strategy and Global Development of our WW Specialist Sales Teams. Moved to France in 2017 to lead MS France Specialist Sales team and back to Redmond in 2020 to focus on our Analytics & AI businesses.

Born in Brazil, I graduated in computer science there and then did my MBA at the Univ. of Pittsburgh.

I love spending time outdoors, travelling with my wife (although not doing any of these lately, of course), cooking (this I have been practicing more), running, snowboarding, and playing with our Labrador Minnie :)

headline: Cloud Solutions Architect at Microsoft
about:
I have provided Business Analysis, Project Management, Cyber Security, and Management Consulting support to government and commercial clients. I leverage over 15 years of IT, management and leadership experience to advise in defining, planning, managing, and achieving strategic vision, while protecting critical IT assets. As a Systems Engineer, I am trained in process engineering, systems thinking, software testing, algorithms, modeling and optimizations.

TECHNICAL SUMMARY

Platforms:	Windows | Linux | Azure | VMware | Kubernetes | AWS | GCP |
Programming:  	C# |  Visual C++ | XML | T-SQL | PowerShell | UML | BPMN | JSON
Software:  			O365 | Exchange | Jira | Confluence | ServiceNow | Visio | ARAS
Databases:  			MSSQL | PostgreSQL | 
Standards:	ISO | 9000 | 14000 | 20000 | 27000 | NIST SP 800-53 | PCI-DSS
Methodologies:	PMI | ITIL | Scrum | DevSecOps | Lean Six Sigma | CMMI | Prosci
Certifications:	MS Project Administration | SharePoint Administration | Power BI Analytics |  M365 | Azure | Dynamics 365 | Modern Service Management  | MSM Governance

headline: Innovative leader committed to a diverse workforce and equal access to quality healthcare
about: Rocio A Lopez has over 18 years of strong program leadership through all phases of drug development in a global context. A high-performance leader, Rocio focuses on problem solving and planning skills related to study design, technical transfers and cross-functional interactions in development areas. She has a broad knowledge base of development paradigms in pharmacology, toxicology and clinical development, in addition to a comprehensive understanding of guidance documents from global regulatory authorities. Rocio confidently focuses on producing high-quality output by keeping herself, and her teams, to very high expectations. She has a unique ability to lead teams and share her vision and forward-thinking, as well as communicate the value offered to clients.
